title: Potting up Tomato Seedlings! ALL 540 of Them!

subtasks: Ensure potting soil is adequately moist before transplanting
Fill trays with moist soil, tamping and leveling
Identify seedlings needing transplanting (having two or more seedlings per cell)
Gently remove seedlings from cells, separating at the base to avoid damaging stems
Pinch bottom of new cells to create holes, inserting roots without damaging them
Water transplanted seedlings thoroughly to avoid transplant shock
Collect and plant individual seedlings into larger cells, pushing roots down to encourage rooting
Sow each plant carefully in the prepared cells, smoothing soil around roots
Water each tray thoroughly, checking for and filling any soil losses
Gradually harden transplanted seedlings before moving to outdoor conditions
Monitor for signs of transplant shock and adjust watering as necessary
Prepare planting location for potential future planting, considering zone and frost dates
